Description: Egyptian terracotta figure fragment, possibly female(?). Fragment of robe from unidentified figure. Mould-made and hollow. Traces of a white coating. Red-brown Nile silt fabric, with abundant mica and sand inclusions.
Curator's comments: Ptolemaic context, possibly from a Tanagra style figurine of a woman.
Bibliographic references: Leonard 2001 / Ancient Naukratis: Excavations at a Greek Emporion in Egypt, Part II: The excavations at Kom Hadid. (p. 171, no.13 pl. 3.13.)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DD.395) (Phase 3)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: pl. 3.11, p. 171. no.13 (catalogue number)
